definition: undiscovered traitor/enemy within one's own ranks

sentences.english: By September, the gang had begun to suspect it had a mole.
sentences.chinese: 到了9月，这伙人开始怀疑出了内奸。

sentences.english: Jia small gun and others design captures the mole, turned out to be a blacksmith.
sentences.chinese: 贾小枪等人设计抓住了内奸，原来是齐铁匠。

sentences.english: Cai Biao suddenly gun against Krishna head, said he was guilty.
sentences.chinese: 蔡彪突然用枪顶住大奎的脑袋，说他是内奸。

sentences.english: He fears that there is another traitor inside the agency.
sentences.chinese: 他担心在办公室里还有另一个内奸。

sentences.english: At CTU, Jack apologizes to Nina about accusing her of being the “dirty” agent.
sentences.chinese: 在反恐组，杰克为自己指责尼娜是内奸而向她道歉。

sentences.english: Li Shiwu doubt gold deep water is the dirty agent.
sentences.chinese: 李士武怀疑金深水就是内奸。

sentences.english: Sun Weijun ask toward him, special task force, who is the mole?
sentences.chinese: 孙维君向他问起，特别行动队，那个内奸到底是谁？

sentences.english: To protect their mole. You getting all this, finch?
sentences.chinese: 保护他们的内奸。你都听见了吗，芬奇？

sentences.english: I'm a Judas, a turncoat, a quisling!
sentences.chinese: 我出卖朋友，我是内奸，是叛徒。

definition: to hide (as an undercover agent)/an insider (in a gang of thieves)/a mole
to kill sb to prevent them from divulging a secret/to silence sb
to instigate (rebellion etc)/incitement (e.g. to desertion within opposing camp)
remaining evil element/surviving members (of evil former regime)/dregs (of colonial administration)
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
